docs.text:
onefootball_network ¶ Python client for the OneFootball Network API This package contains a python client for the OneFootball Network API. It allows OneFootball’s content partners to publish articles onto the OneFootball platform. It also allows partners to update and delete articles that they have already published to the OneFootball platform. The API can be used by partners to set up their own services such that content published on their sites is automatically sent to OneFootball and natively integrated onto the OneFootball platform for OneFootball users. Please note that the OneFootball Network is a closed, invite-only platform and only authorized content partners are able to use the OneFootball Network API. 🚀 Quickstart ¶ You can install onefootball-network-api-py from pip: pip install onefootball-network-api-py The package includes a OneFootballNetwork class which has all methods you need to interact with the api. # main.py from onefootball_network import OneFootballNetwork , NewPost of = OneFootballNetwork () article = NewPost ( external_id = "28961" , source_url = "https://www.clermontfoot.com/amical-orleans-clermont-annule/" , language = "fr" , published = "2020-08-10T08:28:58Z" , title = "Amical : Orl \u00e9 ans – Clermont annul \u00e9 " , content = """

A la demande de l’US Orl \u00e9 ans, le match amical du mercredi 12 ao \u00fb t opposant l’US Orl \u00e9 ans et le Clermont Foot 63 \u00e0 Moulins, est annul \u00e9 .

Le prochain match amical du CF63 est pr \u00e9 vu le samedi 15 ao \u00fb t contre Grenoble et sera retransmis sur le site de La Montagne dans le cadre de notre partenariat.

""" , ) post = of . publish_article ( article ) print ( post . onefootball_id ) 🔧 Development ¶ If you want to contribute to this repository, clone the git repository and run: make develop make test make serve-docs Release History ¶ 0.1.0: first release Contributing ¶ Fork it Create your feature branch ( git checkout -b feature/fooBar ) Commit your changes ( git commit -am 'Add some fooBar' ) Push to the branch ( git push origin feature/fooBar ) Create a new Pull Request
docs.title: Index

docs.text: Python client for the OneFootball Network API This package contains a python client for the OneFootball Network API. It allows OneFootball’s content partners to publish articles onto the OneFootball platform. It also allows partners to update and delete articles that they have already published to the OneFootball platform. The API can be used by partners to set up their own services such that content published on their sites is automatically sent to OneFootball and natively integrated onto the OneFootball platform for OneFootball users. Please note that the OneFootball Network is a closed, invite-only platform and only authorized content partners are able to use the OneFootball Network API.

You can install onefootball-network-api-py from pip: pip install onefootball-network-api-py The package includes a OneFootballNetwork class which has all methods you need to interact with the api. # main.py from onefootball_network import OneFootballNetwork , NewPost of = OneFootballNetwork () article = NewPost ( external_id = "28961" , source_url = "https://www.clermontfoot.com/amical-orleans-clermont-annule/" , language = "fr" , published = "2020-08-10T08:28:58Z" , title = "Amical : Orl \u00e9 ans – Clermont annul \u00e9 " , content = """

A la demande de l’US Orl \u00e9 ans, le match amical du mercredi 12 ao \u00fb t opposant l’US Orl \u00e9 ans et le Clermont Foot 63 \u00e0 Moulins, est annul \u00e9 .

Le prochain match amical du CF63 est pr \u00e9 vu le samedi 15 ao \u00fb t contre Grenoble et sera retransmis sur le site de La Montagne dans le cadre de notre partenariat.

""" , ) post = of . publish_article ( article ) print ( post . onefootball_id )

docs.text:
OneFootballNetwork ¶ ¶ OneFootball Network API Client. __init__ ( self , login = None , password = None ) special ¶ Initialise client. Parameters: Name Type Description Default login Optional[str] email address you use to login on the OneFootball Network portal. If left empty, it is read from the LOGIN environment variable. None password Optional[str] password you use to login on the OneFootball Network portal If left empty, it is read from the PASSWORD environment variable. None Examples: # parse LOGIN and PASSWORD environment variables of = OneFootballNetwork () # or pass them directly of = OneFootballNetwork ( login = "editor@football.com" , password = "mysecret" ) delete_article ( self , onefootball_id ) ¶ Delete one article. Parameters: Name Type Description Default onefootball_id Union[int, str] Article id as defined within the OneFootball Network system required Returns: Type Description bool If True , the article was deleted successfully Examples: of = OneFootballNetwork () of . delete_article ( onefootball_id = "24546" ) get_article ( self , onefootball_id ) ¶ Return a single article by its OneFootball Network id. Parameters: Name Type Description Default onefootball_id Union[int, str] Article id as defined within the OneFootball Network system required Returns: Type Description DetailedPost the article object matching the given ID. Examples: of = OneFootballNetwork () post = of . get_article ( onefootball_id = "2454354" ) print ( post . title ) get_articles ( self , external_id = None , feed_item_id = None ) ¶ List multiple posts created by you. When specifying external_id filter, this endpoint is expected to return a single entity most of the time. Bear in mind that two posts in two different languages can have the same external ID. Parameters: Name Type Description Default external_id Optional[str] The ID of the post as identified in an external system. None feed_item_id Optional[str] A comma separated list of the post feed item IDs. feed_item_id is neither the external_id or the onefootball_id . None Returns: Type Description PostsResponse the list of retrieved article objects. Exceptions: Type Description ValueError When the supplied filter combination is incorrect. Examples: of = OneFootballNetwork () posts = of . get_articles ( external_id = "3" ) # or posts = of . get_articles ( feed_item_id = "990949,990967,995846" ) publish_article ( self , article ) ¶ Publish an article to OneFootball. To use this endpoint, the creator account must have an integration of type "push" configured. Note You can use autocompletion on the NewPost object to see available attributes. The data model will take care of all data validation for you, so that you can focus on passing your content only. Parameters: Name Type Description Default article NewPost a NewPost object with the data of the article to publish required Returns: Type Description DetailedPost the published post Examples: from onefootball_network import OneFootballNetwork , NewPost of = OneFootballNetwork () article = NewPost ( external_id = "28961" , source_url = "https://www.clermontfoot.com/amical-orleans-clermont-annule/" , language = "fr" , published = "2020-08-10T08:28:58Z" , title = "Amical : Orléans – Clermont annulé" , # fmt: off content = '''

A la demande de l’US Orléans, le match amical du mercredi 12 août opposant l’US Orléans et le Clermont Foot 63 à Moulins, est annulé.

Le prochain match amical du CF63 est prévu le samedi 15 août contre Grenoble et sera retransmis sur le site de La Montagne dans le cadre de notre partenariat.

''' # fmt: on ) post = of . publish_article ( article ) print ( post . onefootball_id ) update_article ( self , onefootball_id , article ) ¶ Update a single article. Note You can use autocompletion on the PostUpdate object to see available attributes. The data model will take care of all data validation for you, so that you can focus on passing your content only. Parameters: Name Type Description Default onefootball_id str Article id as defined within the OneFootball Network system required article PostUpdate a PostUpdate object with the article data required Returns: Type Description DetailedPost the published post

docs.text: List multiple posts created by you. When specifying external_id filter, this endpoint is expected to return a single entity most of the time. Bear in mind that two posts in two different languages can have the same external ID. Parameters: Name Type Description Default external_id Optional[str] The ID of the post as identified in an external system. None feed_item_id Optional[str] A comma separated list of the post feed item IDs. feed_item_id is neither the external_id or the onefootball_id . None Returns: Type Description PostsResponse the list of retrieved article objects. Exceptions: Type Description ValueError When the supplied filter combination is incorrect. Examples: of = OneFootballNetwork () posts = of . get_articles ( external_id = "3" ) # or posts = of . get_articles ( feed_item_id = "990949,990967,995846" )
docs.title: get_articles()

docs.text:
Publish an article to OneFootball. To use this endpoint, the creator account must have an integration of type "push" configured. Note You can use autocompletion on the NewPost object to see available attributes. The data model will take care of all data validation for you, so that you can focus on passing your content only. Parameters: Name Type Description Default article NewPost a NewPost object with the data of the article to publish required Returns: Type Description DetailedPost the published post Examples: from onefootball_network import OneFootballNetwork , NewPost of = OneFootballNetwork () article = NewPost ( external_id = "28961" , source_url = "https://www.clermontfoot.com/amical-orleans-clermont-annule/" , language = "fr" , published = "2020-08-10T08:28:58Z" , title = "Amical : Orléans – Clermont annulé" , # fmt: off content = '''

A la demande de l’US Orléans, le match amical du mercredi 12 août opposant l’US Orléans et le Clermont Foot 63 à Moulins, est annulé.

Le prochain match amical du CF63 est prévu le samedi 15 août contre Grenoble et sera retransmis sur le site de La Montagne dans le cadre de notre partenariat.

''' # fmt: on ) post = of . publish_article ( article ) print ( post . onefootball_id )
docs.title: publish_article()

docs.text: Update a single article. Note You can use autocompletion on the PostUpdate object to see available attributes. The data model will take care of all data validation for you, so that you can focus on passing your content only. Parameters: Name Type Description Default onefootball_id str Article id as defined within the OneFootball Network system required article PostUpdate a PostUpdate object with the article data required Returns: Type Description DetailedPost the published post
docs.title: update_article()

docs.text: models ¶ PostUpdate ¶ ¶ Article attributes that can be updated. content: HtmlBody pydantic-field required ¶ The content of the article, which must be in correctly-formatted HTML. Please see this link for important details on acceptable HTML content. image_height: int pydantic-field ¶ The image’s height in pixels. image_url: HttpUrl pydantic-field ¶ An optional field for the URL of the article’s featured image. image_width: int pydantic-field ¶ The image’s width in pixels. language: Language pydantic-field required ¶ The language of the article. modified: datetime pydantic-field ¶ The time that the article was last updated. If in doubt, use the current time. published: datetime pydantic-field required ¶ The time that the article was published. If in doubt, use the current time. source_url: HttpUrl pydantic-field required ¶ The link to the article as published on your website. Place your homepage url if the article is not published anywhere else. title: ConstrainedStrValue pydantic-field required ¶ The title of the article. Config ¶ Custom model config. __json_encoder__ ( obj ) special staticmethod ¶ partial(func, args, *keywords) - new function with partial application of the given arguments and keywords. is_provided_with_image_url ( v , values ) classmethod ¶ If image_url is provided, image_width and image_height should be provided as well. override_default ( v ) classmethod ¶ Handle misleading defaults sent by backend. Defaults: 'image_url': '', 'image_width': 0, 'image_height': 0 NewPost ¶ ¶ A new post payload. draft: bool pydantic-field ¶ An optional boolean to be used for testing purposes. If set to True, the article will not be made visible to OneFootball users. If not povided, the article will by default be made available to OneFootball users. external_id: str pydantic-field required ¶ The ID of the article as defined in your system. It must be unique (within a given language) within your own system. __json_encoder__ ( obj ) special staticmethod ¶ partial(func, args, *keywords) - new function with partial application of the given arguments and keywords. DetailedPost ¶ ¶ A single published post. onefootball_id: str pydantic-field required ¶ The ID of the article as defined in the OneFootball Network API system. __json_encoder__ ( obj ) special staticmethod ¶ partial(func, args, *keywords) - new function with partial application of the given arguments and keywords. PostResponse ¶ ¶ Multiple published posts.
